thread.title: 5 Things Smart Travelers Should Do This September
thread.title_full: 5 Things Smart Travelers Should Do This September

author: Massive rock threatening to crash into base of Arizona dam
title: 5 Things Smart Travelers Should Do This September
text:
5 Things Smart Travelers Should Do This September Condé Nast Traveler 1 day ago © Courtesy Le Sirenuse This month's top travel tips from the experts.
1. See Italy in shoulder season. “September and October are wonderful months on the Amalfi Coast and Capri,” says Andrea Grisdale of IC Bellagio . “Summer crowds are gone, and it’s warm enough to swim. Le Sirenuse is my favorite hotel in Positano.”
2. Lock in next year’s safari. “The Great Migration of wildebeests and zebras starts in the Southern Serengeti in January, but it’s wise to book now since many seasonal camps have limited space,” says Rob Veden of Cox & Kings.
3. Book your annual ski trip. “Reserve hotels for Presidents’ Day weekend or Spring Break now,” says Kay Merrill of Are We There Yet . Luxury resorts like Jackson Hole’s Teton Mountain Lodge & Spa and Park City’s Caledonian do sell out as the season approaches.
4. Plan next September’s cruise. “Now’s the time to book New England and Canada sailings for next fall,” says Linda Allen of Cruises by Linda , because smaller ship lines (Crystal, Oceania) have only a few cabins available for these very popular itineraries.
5. Think Caribbean Christmas. “There is still time to reserve a villa in St. Barts for the holidays,” says Peg Walsh of St. Barth Properties . “And with new villas just going on the market, we have additional inventory this year.”
More from Condé Nast Traveler:
